title: The Wall Street Journal: JPMorgan names new co-presidents; CEO Dimon expects to stay about 5 more years
text:
JPMorgan names Daniel Pinto and Gordon Smith as co-presidents Chief executive Jamie Dimon says he will stay on for about five more years Daniel Pinto Emily Glazer January 30, 2018 Updated: 3:40 p.m. GMT 
JPMorgan has elevated two executives to share the No. 2 post at the nation’s largest bank, the clearest step yet to designate a potential successor to chairman and chief executive James Dimon. 
The bank’s corporate and investment banking chief, Daniel Pinto, and the head of its consumer businesses, Gordon Smith, will share the title of president and chief operating officer, vaulting them above a handful of rival leaders at the New York bank. ...
